p.s: The given text is an excerpt from the book Gun Love, which was written by Jennifer Clement and was published in 2019 and the excerpt with the introduction of a foster child named Helen.
In this scene Helen tries to explain her life to Pearl, which is really hard to describe or understand.
She tells Pearl about her familysfamilies, she was living with.
Then she tells her about the conditions she had in those houses.
Helen even had to sleep on the floor in a hallway in one of her homes.
The narrator points out that she sometimes only got cereals to eat or that she speaks in the third person to herself and that nobody corrected her.
After telling Pearl about her situation, she shows Pearls her collection of telephones and chargers she got from her familysfamilies.
She uses those phones to call her family and her friends.
In this part of the novel you can see that Helen has a very sad life.
She never met her real parents and she got from one foster home to another.
She also didn't become enough education by her familysfamilies.
